definition: ought to/should/must
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
you're most welcome/sure thing!/I did what I was supposed to do

sentences.english: Meditation can help, and should be your first choice before medication.
sentences.chinese: 沉思能幫助你並應該是你就醫前的首選。

sentences.english: The Console should indicate that both subscribers received a copy of the message.
sentences.chinese: 控制檯應該指示兩個訂戶均收到了該消息的複本。

sentences.english: He suggested that tangling fishing gear should be made a criminal offence.
sentences.chinese: 他提議，纏繞捕魚器材應該算刑事犯罪。

sentences.english: Experts said the study should prompt countries to reconsider how they classify drugs.
sentences.chinese: 專家稱，這項研究應該促使各國重新考慮藥品的分類。

sentences.english: Should one renounce Nirvana oneself, in order to help others towards it first?
sentences.chinese: 人應該放棄自己的涅磐，爲了首先幫助它人達到它？

sentences.english: Should I go up to the rooftop?
He was supposed to give us advice, but this ideas were airy-fairy ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他應該給我們提些勸告，但他的主意都是不切實際的。

sentences.english: I think we should let Sylvia go camping with her boy-friend.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我們應該讓Sylvia和她男友一起去宿營。

sentences.english: Many southerners said all of the North was responsible for the raid.
sentences.chinese: 許多南方人說，所有的北方人都應該對這次襲擊負責。

sentences.english: How to use fondaparinux in those patients?
sentences.chinese: 這些患者應該如何使用磺達肝癸鈉？

sentences.english: You shouldn't force food on children.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該強迫孩子們喫東西。

sentences.english: You should look at that house before you decide to buy it.
sentences.chinese: 你應該看看那棟房子再決定購買。

sentences.english: In my opinion, the number of private cars should be put under control.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，應該控制私家車的數量。

sentences.english: A decade ago I might have attended one of Whitney’s seminars (if I could have afforded it).
sentences.chinese: 十年前我就應該參加Whitney的研討班的。

sentences.english: Memory allocation failures should reduce the use of this flag.
sentences.chinese: 如果內存分配失敗過多，應該減少這個標記的使用。

sentences.english: The foot of the wall should be stained brown.

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
or/still/nevertheless/had better
actually/in fact/really
if (coming after a conditional clause)
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
this/this one
now/at present/at the moment/modern/current/nowadays
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
because/owing to/on account of
this kind of/so/this way/like this/such
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
indeed/really/reliable/real/true
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
surname Huan
to pay back/to return
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
